content:
I have a couple self-hosted instances of Zulip 6.0 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS. There have been some errors I see Spit out over the time it has been up. A few months now. Usually, Timeout types of mistakes. I was thinking of updating to the newer 6.02 version. I noticed that Version 7 is due out not that long away.

My questions are:

  1. Should I upgrade to the point releases of Zulip before going to Version 7 when available?
  2. What is best practices for Zulip in trying to keep it up to date. Should I always do the point releases, or can I do the major releases unless there is some MAJOR issue?

Thank you for all you do. I am new to the product, but so far, it has been an excellent experience compared to other open-source projects I have worked with.
@Jerry Broughton We generally recommend always upgrading to the point releases; they're designed to be very low risk upgrades and often fix important security or reliability issues.

You generally don't need to do intermediate upgrades; though see https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/upgrade.html#upgrading-the-operating-system for some cases where that's necessary if you're quite far behind.

You should post the specific errors you're seeing; it is our goal that there not be random exceptions in production instances.

https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/troubleshooting.html has some advice on how to post logs (E.g. use a code block).
